text:
“Hey there, German hatter!” a voice shouted.

The young man froze. He clutched his worn hat. 

“It’s absurd,” he muttered, panic rising. 

“Such a detail could ruin everything. 

I can’t be noticed.” 

He glanced at the hat, torn and bent. 

“Trifles ruin everything,” he whispered. 

He counted his steps to the lodging house. 

Seven hundred and thirty steps. 

Once, he dreamed of daring exploits. 

Now, he felt terror. 

“Why did I think this would work?” 

He shook his head, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man is consumed by anxiety over his conspicuous hat, fearing it could jeopardize his carefully planned actions.
